title: The global tobacco control treaty has reduced smoking rates in its first decade, but more work is needed

title_detail.value: The global tobacco control treaty has reduced smoking rates in its first decade, but more work is needed

summary: Despite worldwide progress since the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (WHO-FCTC) came into effect in 2005, not all key demand-reduction measures have been fully implemented at the same pace, but doing so could reduce tobacco use even further, say researchers.

summary_detail.value: Despite worldwide progress since the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (WHO-FCTC) came into effect in 2005, not all key demand-reduction measures have been fully implemented at the same pace, but doing so could reduce tobacco use even further, say researchers.
